alert.note: Alert for Delaware; Dubuque; Jackson; Jones (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 05 at 12:56AM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Jackson, southern Dubuque, northern Jones and southeastern Delaware Counties through 130 AM CDT... At 1255 AM CDT, trained weather spotters reported a strong thunderstorm over Langworthy, or near Anamosa, moving northeast at 55 mph. Penny size hail was reported north of Anamosa at 1253 AM CDT. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Trained weather spotters. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Cascade and Canton around 110 AM CDT. Bernard around 120 AM CDT. La Motte and Zwingle around 125 AM CDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Swiss Valley Park, Key West, Jones County Fairgrounds, South Gary Owen, Dubuque Regional Airport, Garry Owen, Fillmore, Pictured Rocks Wildlife Area, Rockdale and Mines of Spain. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 100 AM CDT for northeastern Iowa. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch also remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for east central Iowa.
